definition: to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks

sentences.english: Harmonious here dominant is worn everything, be being mixed spicily seldom appear caustically.
sentences.chinese: 和睦在这里主导着一切，讽刺和挖苦是极少出现的。

sentences.english: We get on these broomsticks and ride home.
sentences.chinese: 梅金挖苦道，“那我们还是骑着扫把回家吧。”
她挖苦的语言刺伤了他的虚荣心。

sentences.english: The immediate target of Digger's raillery was his communications officer, a lean morose-looking southerner.
sentences.chinese: 迪格直接的挖苦对象，是他的通讯军官，一个身子。

sentences.english: She often squelches others with biting sarcasm.
sentences.chinese: 她经常用尖刻的挖苦话压服别人。

sentences.english: I admired Jobert's intelligence and sardonic wit.
sentences.chinese: 我欣赏若贝尔的聪明和善于挖苦人的机智。

sentences.english: But he regretted the pleasantry; it was too near a satire.
sentences.chinese: 后来一想，这句笑话太象当面挖苦了，他又后悔起来。

sentences.english: But in Chinese news reports, he was caustic about the state subsidies given his competitors.
sentences.chinese: 但是中文媒体报道，他挖苦竞争者得到的国家补贴。

sentences.english: Sarcasm is the refuge of scoundrels.
He is always having a dig at underachieving students.
sentences.chinese: 他总挖苦成绩差的学生。

sentences.english: She was obviously digging at him.
According to McKittrick, He reamed us out but good.
sentences.chinese: 按照麦克凯特里克上尉的说法，他没好气地挖苦我们。

sentences.english: I am not going to exploit for political purposes my opponent's youth and inexperience.
sentences.chinese: 我不会出于政治目的挖苦我对手的年青和缺乏经验。

sentences.english: Andy talkativeness remarked Ray, it was the season why he considered to ask Andy or not.
sentences.chinese: 安迪爱挖苦雷，这就是为什么他考虑要不要问安迪。

definition: to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
